name: Ahmad Al-Masri
bio: Experienced community leader focused on youth development.
biography: Ahmad has over 15 years of experience in non-profit management, specializing in creating opportunities for underprivileged youth. He founded the 'Future Leaders' initiative in 2010.
education: M.A. in Social Work, King Saud University

name: Leila Abbas
bio: Environmental scientist advocating for sustainable practices.
biography: Leila's research on desert ecology has been published in several international journals. She is a passionate advocate for water conservation in arid regions.
work: Senior Researcher, King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology
education: Ph.D. in Environmental Science, University of Cambridge

name: Omar Farook
bio: Tech entrepreneur building innovative solutions for the region.
biography: Founder and CEO of 'Nexus Tech', a successful software company. Omar is a frequent speaker at regional tech conferences and mentors young entrepreneurs.
education: B.Sc. in Computer Engineering, American University of Beirut

name: Yasmin Hamdi
bio: Award-winning journalist known for in-depth cultural reporting.
biography: Yasmin has worked for major regional news outlets for over a decade. Her documentary series on traditional crafts won the 'Golden Pen' award.
education: M.A. in Journalism, Columbia University

name: Khalid Nasser
bio: Medical doctor specializing in public health initiatives.
biography: Dr. Nasser has led numerous vaccination and health awareness campaigns in remote areas. He is dedicated to improving healthcare access for all.
work: Head of Public Health, Western Region
education: M.D., King Abdulaziz University

name: Sana Odeh
bio: Legal expert in international human rights law.
biography: Sana has represented clients in several international courts. She is a founding member of the 'Justice for All' legal aid society.
education: LL.M. in International Law, Yale Law School

name: Tariq Mahmoud
bio: Historian preserving the region's rich cultural heritage.
biography: Author of 'Echoes of the Past', a comprehensive history of the Hijaz region. Tariq works with the Ministry of Culture to restore historical sites.
education: Ph.D. in History, University of Chicago

name: Noor Al-Farsi
bio: Artist whose work explores themes of identity and tradition.
biography: Noor's paintings have been exhibited in galleries across the Middle East and Europe. Her latest series, 'Threads', explores the interconnectedness of cultures.
education: B.F.A., Tehran University of Art

name: Hassan Al-Otaibi
bio: Engineer developing sustainable energy solutions.
biography: Lead engineer on the 'Solar Horizon' project, one of the largest solar farms in the region. Hassan is passionate about technological innovation for environmental benefit.
education: M.Sc. in Renewable Energy Engineering, Stanford University

name: Mariam Saleh
bio: Educator championing digital literacy for all ages.
biography: Mariam founded the 'Digital Bridge' program, teaching computer skills to seniors and underserved communities. She believes technology should be accessible to everyone.
work: Head of Community Programs, TechForAll NGO
education: B.Ed. in Educational Technology, King Saud University

name: Faisal Ghani
bio: Economist analyzing regional market trends and development.
biography: Chief Economist at a major regional bank. Faisal's insights on economic diversification strategies are frequently cited in policy discussions.
education: Ph.D. in Economics, London School of Economics

name: Aisha Karim
bio: Social worker dedicated to women's empowerment and family support.
biography: Aisha runs a shelter for women in need and provides vocational training. Her 'EmpowerHer' initiative has helped hundreds of women achieve financial independence.
education: M.S.W., University of Toronto

name: Bashir Al-Tamimi
bio: Agriculturalist improving farming techniques in arid climates.
biography: Bashir's research on drought-resistant crops has significantly improved yields for local farmers. He is a strong advocate for food security.
work: Senior Agronomist, Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture
education: Ph.D. in Agronomy, University of California, Davis

name: Layla Mustafa
bio: Architect designing sustainable and culturally sensitive buildings.
biography: Layla's designs blend modern functionality with traditional Arabian architectural elements. Her 'Green Oasis' housing project won a regional sustainability award.
education: M.Arch., Harvard Graduate School of Design

name: Nasser Al-Dossari
bio: Veterinarian providing care for livestock and wildlife.
biography: Dr. Al-Dossari runs a mobile clinic serving remote Bedouin communities. He is also involved in conservation efforts for endangered species in the region.
education: D.V.M., University of Sydney

name: Samira Al-Harthi
bio: Entrepreneur creating employment opportunities through her business.
biography: Founder of 'Al-Anoud', a successful chain of stores selling handmade crafts by local artisans. Samira is committed to supporting small businesses and local talent.
education: MBA, INSEAD

name: Rashid Al-Saud
bio: Diplomat fostering international cooperation and cultural exchange.
biography: Ambassador to several European countries. Rashid has played a key role in negotiating trade agreements and cultural partnerships that benefit the region.
education: M.A. in International Relations, Georgetown University

name: Hind Al-Khalifa
bio: Researcher advancing knowledge in molecular biology and genetics.
biography: Dr. Al-Khalifa's groundbreaking research on genetic markers for hereditary diseases has opened new avenues for early diagnosis and treatment.
work: Lead Scientist, King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Centre
education: Ph.D. in Molecular Biology, University of Oxford

name: Zain Al-Abidine
bio: Musician and composer celebrating traditional melodies.
biography: Zain is a master of the oud and has composed music for several acclaimed films. His 'Heritage Ensemble' performs traditional music for international audiences.
education: Diploma in Music Composition, Cairo Academy of Arts

name: Reem Al-Qahtani
bio: Sports coach promoting fitness and teamwork among youth.
biography: National women's football team coach. Reem has been instrumental in developing female sports programs and inspiring a new generation of athletes.
work: Head Coach, National Women's Football Team
education: B.Sc. in Physical Education, Princess Nora bint Abdul Rahman University
